intro: Lesquerella montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevidense lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and southern Brazil. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, glandular leaves that help it retain moisture in its native habitat. Its seeds contain a unique oil rich in hydroxy fatty acids, which has potential industrial and medicinal applications. Lesquerella montevidensis is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
